runs.comm: bouncer to start, well directed, calmly negotiated to launch Rafitullah's career
outside off, a flat-footed swish and no contact
width, and Rafitullah is off the mark in international cricket, a uppercut over the slips, I think he intended that but perhaps finer than he meant ...
edged and dropped! A similar stroke, uppercut and that arrived quickly at Billings, who had been shaping down the leg-side. Slip can't gather the parry
outside off, cut hard but well cut off at point
slippery pace, a play and a miss. A lively over!
dabbed towards third man, Sarfraz is up and running
slashed backward of point, there is a third man in place though and the damage is limited to a single
down on one knee, swept powerfully, but straight into the hands of deep backward square! Topley strikes, and Sarfraz is gone
through to the keeper
makes room on the leg-side, scythes the bat through the line and lobbed into no-man's land at deep cover
down the track, almost pirouettes in his follow-through as Billings gathers
full length, angled in, blocked on off stump
on the pads, clipped to midwicket
outside off, an attractive cover drive, but about six inches inside the line of the ball. Through to the keeper but Hafeez holds the pose for the cameras
shorter, and pulled out to midwicket
slower-ball bouncer, down the track to have a smack but beaten by the length and pace
too much width outside off stump
on the toes, stunning pick-up. Nailed that for a one-bounce four through backward square. Timing and placement
good pace from a strong action. Defended
chopped out to point, again from a full length
short and Rafatullah has a swipe across the line but can't lay bat on ball
chopped to gully and that bounced inches short of the fielder, as did the shy to the non-striker's end, which would have been out with a direct hit. Dicey times
short and pulled sweetly through the leg-side, always going up but clean into space
an even better connection on this pull shot, but he's picked out the only man in the deep on the leg-side! A sucker dismissal and England firmly in the mix here
full length, attacking the top of off, chopped down to the cordon
swished through point, finds the gap and hurries back for the second run. Swift moves for an old stager
slower ball, a bit of dancing at the crease before the ball arrives, and a chunky pull through midwicket
clipped into the leg-side, not especially well timed but picking the gaps well
full length and well grabbed in the follow-through to save the single
good finish to the over, full and straight, hustled defence to see out the over

swished across the line, good sharp pace as Rafatullah has another mow across the line and another thin top-edge that Billings, this time, grabs with no alarms. Reward for aggression, and the end of an unfulfilled debut innings
full length and pushed into the covers
banged in short again, pulled firmly out to deep midwicket where a valiant full-length dive from Topley can only tip the ball onto the boundary rope
driven into the covers
on the pads and flicked into the leg-side, finds the gap and they come back for two
on the pads again, slightly misdirected and worked to leg
on the pads, flicked into the leg-side
tossed up, a teasing length outside off, and a half-connected drive
beautiful strike, to the pitch of the ball this time and if that ball had pants, they would have been timed off by now
good riposte, outside off, and a flat-footed poke goes through to the keeper
quicker ball, fended away with a stumbling defence
dabbed to point, tip and run
looped onto a good length, driven into the covers
good footwork, but driven all along the ground to long-off
tossed up, good teasing flight, that was much slower and loopier, and Maqsood nearly bunted a lofted drive to deep cover

supreme slow bowling! Absolutely kippered by a ball so paceless it barely had the momentum to stay airborne. But Rizwan was through his shot about six times over before the ball died at his feet, and Billings would have completed a facile stumping if middle stump hadn't got in the way
driven into the covers, calmly done
tossed up again, pull the pin next time ... tapped to midwicket
tucked to midwicket
patted to point
down the track, walloped across the line, and tidied up at deep midwicket
uses the feet again to work another off-stump delivery out to deep midwicket
battered. Right in the slot and thumped high and mighty over long-on
outside off stump, helped down to deep point with a languid cut
blocked back to the bowler, slow and slower from Parry
round the wicket, swept, and under-edged through the keeper's legs
driven into the covers, tossed right into the slot, but the variation in pace denies full timing on the stroke
chopped to point, that was quicker and flatter
another flatter delivery, and Pakistan are struggling to pick his variations in pace. Fine bowling
cracked down to long-off
sharp spin from a full length, but a clever back-cut beats the diving man at gully and finds the gap at third man
worked square, and nearly a mix-up as they threaten to come back for two
driven hard, but back to the bowler
on the toes, clipped to midwicket
clipped to midwicket again to keep the strike
too short, and too slow to be too short. That could have gone anywhere ... Umar chose the top tier at cow corner

inept running! A flapped pull to midwicket, and after a give-and-go call, both men ended up sprinting for the non-striker's end, both dipping for the line like Lewis and Christie at Tokyo in 1991. And I have no idea who has actually been given out here ... the third umpire is consulted, and after one of the more comical referrals in cricket history, Umar Akmal is the man given his marching orders, beaten by the width of Maqsood's bat-toe ...
safely negotiated so far ..
driven, hopelessly, to mid-off! No pace whatsoever. Boom Boom splut-spluts. His eyes were as wide as saucers as that ball teased its way towards his yawning blade ... oops
a hint of turn from a full length, nudged to gully
straightens on off stump, another fine over
Maqsood advances, Moeen slides one down the leg-side, Billings gathers well. Toodlepip...
round the wicket, clipped to midwicket
spin, from outside off, strikes the pads but no thought of an appeal
pushed to the leg-side, an unusually calm shot in the current circumstances
tossed up again
attempted reverse-sweep, Morgan gets a finger to a fleeting chance but can't cling on!
blocked back down the track
worked off the toes through backward square
down the wicket, flogged over long-on, and that bounces violently back off the boundary boards
quicker ball, angled to midwicket
clipped square
round the wicket, held back in flight, but well connected this time, straight down the ground, and that's a thumping end to a fine spell from Parry
round the wicket, driven hard to cover and a quick call
helped with the angle through backward square. Well fielded with a slide
outside off, good pace and a swing and a miss results
another change of pace from Plunkett, a off-cutting yorker, under-edged through to Billings who reacts well to gather
played late, down to third man, the hundred comes up, but a long haul to salvage this match yet
driven on the up, spirals into the covers, Morgan takes the catch on the edge of the ring. No Sri Lanka-style heroics for Anwar, this game is nearly done
massive straight drive, Moeen dives in vain, just out of reach of his fingertips
woomphed through midwicket, that was flogged hard and found the gap
down the leg-side but clips the hip for Billings to gather with a dive. A wide saved, as well as four leg-byes
massive misdirection, Harmison-esque in its off-side tendencies...
another wide, down the leg-side again
slower ball, slapped high and not-very-mighty into the covers, but bisects two fielders as Parry in the end stretches low but can't gather
full and straight, defended down into the crease and they steal a single
smashed off the front foot, not entirely timed but well enough placed in the covers. A spurious over from Jordan and Pakistan cling onto hope
on the pads, flicked very fine and another boundary to ramp up the pressure a touch ...
chiselled into the leg-side but they settle for a single
round the wicket and that's a sizzling bouncer! Short, sharp and well avoided, let alone scored-off
slower and fuller, an unnerved swish across the line. Very canny double-whammy
full from round the wicket, clatters the pads on the angle and they steal a single
yorker, excellent finish. A very fine spell, 4-0-21-3, including 13 dot-balls out of 24
down on one knee. The "will-you-marry-me" air-shot. Negative, is the jilting answer
fuller, straighter, pushed to cover
flogged, on the up, over midwicket. Get some of that
down the leg-side, pressure, pressure!
slower ball, and well bowled that time
lovely ball, an inswinging yorker, just grazes past the off stump. But the priceless dot is almost as important
slower ball, clever thinking (I think) but a bit of a jumbled release. Out of the back of the hand, like a badly executed Jade Dernbach impression
yorker. Good comeback. No getting that one away
very full, angled across the left-hander, very difficult to get any power or elevation on that
spanked from a full length, but again, no chance to get under the ball and over the rope
finding his yorker again, good stuff from Jordan. This is killing Pakistan's prospects
full once more, but just a fraction of width allowed Wahab to free his arms and pierce the point boundary
full toss, flashed away past the diving Billings! Another four, and Pakistan cling to hope!
full toss again, but shanked to mid-off. Twenty from six is the equation
outside off, swinging away, and Topley gets away with one. The batsman gave himself too much room to connect with his wallop
similar delivery, Wahab stands his ground this time and flails a one-bounce four over long-off!
smashed down the ground! Huge excitement for a split-second as the crowd sense a six, but Moeen at long-on is in position to poop the party ...
swished down the ground, but all along the ground
bunted down to Moeen at long-off, who gathers on the bounce
nope, he can't! A swing, an edge, all over Red Rover!
